io.vertx.spi.cluster.hazelcast

Class HazelcastClusterManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.vertx.spi.cluster.hazelcast.HazelcastClusterManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.hazelcast.core.LifecycleListener, com.hazelcast.core.MembershipListener, ClusterManager, EventListener

    public class HazelcastClusterManager
extends Object
implements ClusterManager, com.hazelcast.core.MembershipListener, com.hazelcast.core.LifecycleListener
    A cluster manager that uses Hazelcast
    Author:
    Tim Fox

      • getAsyncMultiMap

        public <K,V> void getAsyncMultiMap(String name,
                                   Handler<AsyncResult<AsyncMultiMap<K,V>>> resultHandler)
        Every eventbus handler has an ID. SubsMap (subscriber map) is a MultiMap which maps handler-IDs with server-IDs and thus allows the eventbus to determine where to send messages.
        Specified by:
        getAsyncMultiMap in interface ClusterManager
        Parameters:
        name - A unique name by which the the MultiMap can be identified within the cluster. See the cluster config file (e.g. cluster.xml in case of HazelcastClusterManager) for additional MultiMap config parameters.
        resultHandler - handler receiving the multimap

      • loadConfig

        public com.hazelcast.config.Config loadConfig()
        Load Hazelcast config XML and transform it into a Config object. The content is read from:
        1. the location denoted by the vertx.hazelcast.config sysprop, if present, or
        2. the cluster.xml file on the classpath, if present, or
        3. the default config file

        The cluster manager uses this method to load the config when the node joins the cluster, if no config was provided upon creation.

        You may use this method to get a base config and customize it before the node joins the cluster. In this case, don't forget to invoke setConfig(Config) after you applied your changes.

        Returns:
        a config object
